meanings.definition: To rule or decide against something
meanings.sent1: The judge was overruling the objection raised by the defense.
meanings.sent2: The court overruled the previous decision and issued a new verdict.
meanings.sent3: Despite the loud protests, the judge kept overruling every argument.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was overruling any doubts that tried to creep in.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's authority overruled any attempts at misbehavior in the classroom.

meanings.definition: To have more power or influence than something else
meanings.sent1: The CEO's decision overruled all other opinions in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: In this company, the board's decision always overrules individual preferences.
meanings.sent3: The loud music was overruling the conversation at the party.
meanings.sent4: The storm's intensity overruled any attempts to stay dry.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brightness overruled the dim light of the streetlamp.

meanings.sent1: The overruling theme of the movie was love conquering all obstacles.
meanings.sent2: In the debate, the overruling argument was the importance of education.
meanings.sent3: The overruling color in her wardrobe was blue, with hints of green.
meanings.sent4: His overruling presence in the room made everyone turn to look at him.
meanings.sent5: The overruling scent of fresh flowers filled the entire garden.
